title: It's the summer of Express on Channel 9
body: <a href="http://channel9.msdn.com/express/" title="It is a summer of express on Channel 9">    <img src="http://channel9.msdn.com/express/contesticon.gif" border="0" alt="It is a summer of express on Channel 9" /></a><br/>I'm still installing the <a href="http://lab.msdn.microsoft.com/express/vwd/default.aspx">Visual Web Developer 2005 Express Edition Beta</a> now.  Maybe they should've used bittorrent for that gi-normous .NET 2.0 Beta download ;-)   I can't wait to win that damn xbox with my l33t c# web skillz.<br/><br/>[UPDATE]: It's installed.  At first glance I'd have to say I like it.  (standards compliance is always a good thing!)  I'd highly recommend grabbing the separate installs for the <a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=F1232C37-0FEE-4AA6-AA89-B6DCEFC0873B&displaylang=en">.NET 2.0 Beta</a> and <a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=2CCF2AB6-BFD9-4AC8-B31D-DDBAD7D532A2&displaylang=en">SQL Server 2005 Beta</a>.  Downloading and installing those first will save you a tremendous amount of time.  (<a href="http://lab.msdn.microsoft.com/express/">more versions of Express</a>)
bodyArticleHtml:
2004-06-29

It's the summer of Express on Channel 9
It is a summer of express on Channel 9
